intro: Argomuellera, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its broad, velvety leaves and showy, often yellow or orange flowers. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and forest edges. Argomuellera species are sometimes used in traditional medicine and can be invasive in certain areas.
